Summary: Right off the bat - the area was fine. Some "colorful" characters on the street, but we have never felt threatened. Not the best as far as nearby businesses, but I f you have a car, you'll be okay. Clean. If you use the Sahara as a base of operations, you'll be okay. If you relax in the room, you will be comfortable with one exception: like the last time we stayed, the lighting is sparse and stark.  Maybe lower wattage bulbs would be the answer. Good TV and Wifi. The Sahara will never show up in Better Homes And Gardens, but it does its job.
Room tip: We had a room in the south building. Quiet and dark in the morning.

Summary Heading: Shady neighborhood.  Advertising says close to Disney, but is not up to Disney standards at all.
Summary: Traveling from wa state with kids.  We arrived late and standing out front by the office are a bunch of people looking like they were up to no good.  We got in late and I had booked with military travel club so reservations were already paid.  We won’t be staying rest of stay- feeling very uneasy.    On Theo positive side- rooms look to be recently remodeled.  Bed was comfortable.  Bathroom not fantastic but is serviceable.  One fridge didn’t work.
Room tip: Price is good- but doesn’t feel very safe.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We will  take care better next visit.

Summary: The Sahara is a good deal if you prepare. A) Not enough outlets. Can be overcome if you bring extension cords and/or splitters. B) Not enough lamps. Can be overcome if you bring small lamp(s). There is overhead lighting, but it is bright and stark. C) Bathtub is slick Bring a bath mat. D) Not enough trash cans. Bring at least one. Okay, now the good - Our room was spacious. The bed was excellent. The A/C worked well and was quiet. The Sahara has two buildings, one facing North amd one facing South. We were in the North facing building, which is one story. Very quiet and dark for sleeping. If you prepare for the (small) drawbacks, the Sahara is a good deal. Good location. Easy to get in and out. We were teated well by management.
Room tip: Rooms facing North are quiet. One story, so no one above you. Cannot judge the two story building.

Summary Heading: Great bed.  Quiet and clean room.  Very Comfortable.
Summary: The King size bed is Marriott quality.  The staff is nice.  The room is spacious.  The lighting in the room is very bright.  Bring extra hooks if you want to hang your towel in the bathroom.  The television has a variety of channels including HBO but it pixelates a bit.  Two comfortable chairs in addition to desk chair and a nice refrigerator.  The driveway is easy for drive in and out with plenty of parking spaces.  You will sleep well at the Sahara.
Room tip: You can first floor rooms with no one above you.

Summary: Not luxurious but nice if on a budget. I spent $200 for 3 nights total. I know people that spent that, (and twice that) per night. I was ok with Uber and Lyft 4 miles from the convention center. I'd recommend it for a weekend in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great Value and a Nice, Clean Room
Summary: I’ve stayed at this motel a few times now and I can honestly say that it’s my go-to place if I need to stay in this area overnight. The rooms are clean, the sheets and blankets were very soft and comfortable. And there’s a mini fridge and microwave. The staff is also very nice. The man at the front desk was very kind and helpful during our stay.  If you’re like me and just looking for a place to crash for the night in between Disneyland visits, this is an excellent place to stay.

Summary Heading: Staff were rude, room smelled very musty.
Summary: I prefer budget Motels, but this is one of the worst. The staff were rude both on check in and check out (forgetting about my key deposit). The room was clean enough, but smelled very musty. At the very least the room needs a really good clean every now and again, and this room is not passing the quick vacuum and dust. There are a couple other budget hotels in this area, that are much nicer.

Summary Heading: great price, great location and nice staff
Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights with my best friend when we went to Disneyland. It was a clean room, the guy that ran the front desk was very nice and very pleasant. We arrived a bit sooner than check in started and he had no problem letting us check in early, even gave me the option of upstairs or downstairs. parking was free and my car was right outside my room which was nice to be able to see it and have easy access to it the whole stay. I would 100% stay here again and would recommend it to anyone staying I the area.

We have just stayed at the Sahara for 9 nights. It was a great base for us to use while visiting L.A. the location is fantastic, not far from Huntington Beach, few mins from Buena Park and some great malls near by too.   Free parking which was great as we had a rental car. The pool was clean and we used it twice on really hot days.   The room was a little dated but they were very clean, the beds were really comfortable and the air con worked. There are plenty of TV channels. The owner was very friendly and helpful.  We will be staying again when in the Anaheim area, thanks!

Stayed here with my fiancé for about 5 days while we stayed in Anaheim. Yes it is dated, I can't lie it epitomises the word "budget" but by the same token having stayed in the Anaheim/Buena park area a few times now I'd say most of the hotels have the exact same type of rooms. If your a family stay at the knotts hotel or somewhere near Disney, for everyone else (unless your very picky) it's a good choice if your on a budget. Easily the best price for a hotel in the area.   Pros: central to plenty of stuff: Buena Park downtown is a 5 minute drive away, Walmart neighbourhood mart and CVS within walking distance, coin op laundry around the corner. There's a cool little mall in cypress 10minutes down the road too. Disney and knotts are super close and Huntington Beach 30mins away.

Summary Heading: Great Place To Hang Your Hat and Sleep
Summary: I was traveling in a group of 7, seeing concerts in various places. This was one of the stops we made. I booked through Expedia.   We had to drive from Las Vegas to Anaheim, after a late night event at a band's clothing store. I would be much later than the expected late afternoon check in time. I called ahead and the owner assured me the rooms wouldn't be given away and I was fine.  I pulled up to the hotel at 4:30am. I was exhausted. The owner came out to greet me. He was happy to see I made it in safely (he expressed concern for me driving that late at night). He gave me the room keys and offered the remotes for the TV (which we declined as we would be sleeping, getting up and ready to go to a concert, then coming back to sleep and repeat).  I parked in the handicapped van

My boyfriend and I booked this hotel for the value rate and it was also a very short drive to Disneyland. We stayed for 4 nights and were well prepared to make sure the room felt comfortable. But, if we didn't come prepared with Lysol wipes, mothballs, extra blankets and towels, and the like - the stay would have been a little stressful. The motel is owned by a nice couple but the problem with family owned motels is that it shows wear and tear in the upkeep. The entire time we were there, painting and maintenance was going on with the pool and railings. It wasn't too noisy, but we didn't get access to the pool. Going in to the room it just looks like they did a quick sweep and wipe down but did not get rid of the excess dust and cobwebs. Although the fridge and microwave are a

This motel is a little older would be nice if they could update the bathrooms, beds comfortable, its clean, nicely decorated and in a great location, no breakfast.  Access to Knott's and Disneyland very close by.

Visiting from Australia we had been driving a long time as we hired a car and needed somewhere to rest in the early hrs. It had a neon sign stating 'open 24 hrs'. There was no one at reception. When we rang the bell, the owner couple seemed angry we woke them up and were extremely rude. We put the credit card in for payment and it was declining...because the rude little man at the desk was pressing CANCEL on purpose-thinking he was secretly turned to one side, but we saw him do it! After 4 attempts, he demanded cash only. We said we'd get it from the car and we sped off. Creepy looking place and so much extra furniture sitting around the outside of the building. Bed linen also strangely hanging from the pool fences. Very odd. Glad we didn't stay!

Stayed here on business for 2 nights. Was it the cleanest, most sparkling 5-star deluxe hotel I've ever stayed in? No. Did it have everything I needed for the price I paid? Absolutely. The beds were clean and bug free. My belongings and I stayed safe. It was close to food and disneyland, plus it was quiet. I wouldn't recommend it for families with babies who may crawl around on the floor or get into dated cupboards with questionable contents, or anyone high-maintenance, as the pool was down, and there is no breakfast. However, if you're looking for an affordable place to rest your head, working facilities with hot water, a refrigerator, microwave, television, clean bedding and linens, well, this is your spot. If I am still on a budget next time I'm in town, I would stay here

The rooms are a bit out dated, however they are clean and maintained daily. The tv is pretty big with cable and the wifi is free and really fast! If you want a cheap stay that is close to knotts berry farm and disneyland this is it!

Stayed here on our weekend trip to disneyland. Room was as expected from the looks of the motel. For some reason there was about 4 chairs, a small table plus a huge desk and the rest of the furniture, room was very cramped. Awkward setup for the fridge and microwave, as they sat on some small tables. Bed was comfortable, but the carpet was very dirty. Overall, decent stay for a night, great location for the price. Right down the street from both Knotts berry farm and Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay in neat and clean room
Summary: Motel's owner was very helpful. We were traveling with a lap child . He gave the room key without completing all formalities so that my spouse can take care child. Room was nice and clean. It contains a microwave and small refrigerator. Motel does not provide any Breakfast in morning. It has the pool and looks clean. Bathroom was also neat and clean. Motel has machine for Ice cubes and vending machine for water/soft drinks. It is very near to Disneyland ( around 5 miles). Though the decor of this hotel and room wasn't that modern but he was worth as per its cost. I would recommend this to my friends who would want to enjoy a very decent stay for low cost. I will be happy to stay there if I ever get chance to visit Disneyland again.

Avoid it at any cost. Ac and wifi do not work. No ice machine and vending machine are out of order. The room looks dirty. Yes, its cheap but you will get better service at other cheaper places.  I had a horrible experience here.

Stayed 05/23- 05/25,after calling many hotels with no vacancy or outrages prices for Memorial Day weekend, I found the Sahara. I had read the reviews and was a little skeptical of what i was getting. When we arrived I was very pleased, definitely great room for a great price. Right on the beach close enough to all the boardwalk fun but still far enough away that it is quiet. I was very impressed with how clean our room was not even any dust on the picture frames or the wall mounted lights, and the bathroom was also spotless, there were plenty of towels, toilet paper, body was, and tissues.I will deff be staying again.

Though the decor of this hotel and room wasn't that modern, the staff were very friendly. I had been there with my wife and kid, the staff helped us a lot in getting us comfortable. I would recommend this to my friends who would want to enjoy a very decent stay for low cost.The hotel was quite close to disney and very close to knott's berry farm..

Summary Heading: I didn't want to be in this room too long
Summary: My husband, 7 year old daughter and I stayed here for one night. Everything about this place is out of date, including the TV and the air conditioner that couldn't keep our room cool enough for us to sleep under the covers.  While we were trying to sleep, our daughter woke us because there was a bug on the wall. When we awoke to inspect, it was a baby cockroach that she said "crawled out of the attic" (there was an opening to the establishment's storage attic above our bed. When we arrived, they had a duvet hanging over the gate of the very small pool. The room was pretty small, and the furniture was way too big for the room. One king size bed, a huge armoir, two night stands, four chairs, a large dresser, and an inexplicable dining table filling a room that couldn't be more

Summary Heading: Outdated decor, but clean and very comfy
Summary: I booked this hotel online at Priceline.com the day before my trip to Buena Park.   I was wary when I approached the property. I've heard scary things about Beach Blvd after dark.  However, the staff was super friendly, even at 2am. Updated room key entry. The decor was very 70s; it reminded me of my great-grandma's house. But there were no bugs, the bathroom and sheets were clean, and the AC was nice and cold. The beds were extremely comfortable, even if the pillows were a little flat.  Upon waking up in the morning (which we didn't want to do because of the comfy beds and dark-enough room thanks to the black-out curtains that didn't gap), I was pleased to see they even had the Disney Channel. Two happy kids were able to wake up and get dressed while watching their favorite

Well we stayed 3 nights and management was very friendly. Our room was clean and beds were comfortable. Walking distance to restaurants. Swimming pool was very clean. I recommend this establishment which is family owned and managed.
